sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"转动，旋转"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: rotate, revolve, roll, spin, turn, whirl, circle
means: rotate ： 侧重指物体围绕自己的轴或中心旋转，即自转。
revolve ： 强调指物体围绕本身以外的中心旋转，即公转。
roll ： 指某物在平面上滚动或翻滚。
spin ： 指沿内轴迅速而连续旋转，或沿外部一个点作快速圆周运转。
turn ： 普通用词，中性，含义不确切，可指作一个圆周运动或连续地作圆周运动，也可指仅是沿圆的弧形转动。
whirl ： 指旋转或作圆周运动，侧重急速或力量。

word_mean: 航空器在持续的失速状态下，以很小的半径沿很陡的螺旋线航迹面旋转，同时急剧下降的运动。

jx.jx_en_mean: (N. Amer. informal)waste one's time or efforts
jx.jx_cn_mean: (北美，非正式)浪费时间（或精力）

jx.jx_en_mean: (of a parent company) turn a subsidiary into a new and separate company
jx.jx_cn_mean: （母公司）将子公司转化为独立的新公司

jx.jx_en_mean: make something last as long as possible

lj.lj_ly: they seem keen to spin out the debate through their speeches and interventions.
lj.lj_ls: 他们看来很想用不停的发言和插话把辩论尽可能拖下去。

jx.jx_en_mean: (spin someone/thing out)(Cricket)dismiss a batsman or side by spin bowling
jx.jx_cn_mean: (板球)投旋转球使击球手退场

jx.jx_en_mean: To derive (a company or product, for example) from something larger.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 分割：从更大的实体中派生出（如公司或产品）

jx.jx_en_mean: To rotate out of control, as a skidding car leaving a roadway.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 翻滚：打滑失控，如汽车打滑而冲出路面

jx.jx_en_mean: To expend effort with no result.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English spinnan 'draw out and twist (fibre'); related to German spinnen. The noun dates from the mid 19th cent

entry.def: If something spins or if you spin it, it turns quickly around a central point.

example.ex: The latest discs, used for small portable computers, spin 3600 times a minute...
example.tran: 用在小型便携式计算机上的最新光盘转速为每分钟 3,600 转。

example.ex: The Earth spins on its own axis...

entry.tran: (用甩干机或洗衣机)甩干（衣服），给…脱水
entry.def: When you spin washing, it is turned round and round quickly in a spin drier or a washing machine to get the water out.

example.ex: Just spin the washing and it's nearly dry.
example.tran: 只需要将洗好的衣物脱水，它就差不多干了。

entry.def: If your head is spinning, you feel unsteady or confused, for example because you are drunk, ill, or excited.

example.ex: My head was spinning from the wine...
example.tran: 我喝了葡萄酒后晕乎乎的。

example.ex: All those figures make my poor head spin.
example.tran: 那么多数字把我搞得头昏脑胀。

entry.tran: 带倾向性的解释(或说法)
entry.def: If someone puts a certain spin on an event or situation, they interpret it and try to present it in a particular way.

example.ex: He interpreted the vote as support for the constitution and that is the spin his supporters are putting on the results today.
example.tran: 他把这次投票解释为对宪法的支持，这也是他的支持者对今天的投票结果所作的解释。

example.ex: ...the wholly improper political spin given to the report, particularly by The New York Times.
example.tran: 报道中带有的根本不恰当的政治倾向，特别是《纽约时报》的报道

entry.def: In politics, spin is the way in which political parties try to present everything they do in a positive way to the public and the media.

example.ex: The public is sick of spin and tired of promises. It's time for politicians to act.
example.tran: 公众厌烦了那些有倾向性的报道和种种许诺。该是用政绩说话的时候了。

entry.def: If you go for a spin or take a car for a spin, you make a short journey in a car just to enjoy yourself.
If someone spins a story, they give you an account of something that is untrue or only partly true.

example.ex: He was surprised, and annoyed that she had spun a story which was too good to be condemned as a simple lie.
example.tran: 他很惊讶，也很生气，因为她编的故事太真实了，甚至不能被斥为一个简单的谎言。

entry.def: When people spin, they make thread by twisting together pieces of a fibre such as wool or cotton using a device or machine.

example.ex: Michelle will also spin a customer's wool fleece to specification at a cost of $2.25 an ounce.
example.tran: 米歇尔也会按顾客的要求为其纺羊毛呢，每盎司收费 2.25 美元。

entry.tran: (飞机的)螺旋式急遽下坠，向下旋冲
entry.def: If a plane goes into a spin, it falls very rapidly towards the ground in a spiral movement.

entry.tran: (网球或板球运动中球的）快速旋转，旋转运动
entry.def: In a game such as tennis or cricket, if you put spin on a ball, you deliberately make it spin rapidly when you hit it or throw it.
If you say that someone is in a spin or in a flat spin, you mean that they are confused and unable to act sensibly because of something that has happened.

example.ex: Poor Jane was in rather a spin about the party.
example.tran: 可怜的简对这次聚会真有些不知所措。

means.word_mean: 1. a swift whirling motion (usually of a missile)
3. a short drive in a car;

sentences.sentence: "he took the new car for a spin"

means.word_mean: 4. rapid descent of an aircraft in a steep spiral
5. a distinctive interpretation (especially as used by politicians to sway public opinion);

sentences.sentence: "the campaign put a favorable spin on the story"

means.word_mean: 1. revolve quickly and repeatedly around one's own axis;

sentences.sentence: "The dervishes whirl around and around without getting dizzy"
"The creek spun its course through the woods"

means.word_mean: 5. form a web by making a thread;
6. work natural fibers into a thread;
7. twist and turn so as to give an intended interpretation;

sentences.sentence: "The President's spokesmen had to spin the story to make it less embarrasing"

list.explanation: 为其雇主利益传播倾向性信息的代理人(尤指为政奔效劳而误导舆论界)

example.en: Things were going bad for the President,so he got himself a new spin doctor.
example.zh: 形势的发展对总统很不利，所以他给自已找了个新的能旋转方向的代言人。

auth_sentence.res_content_con: An adult spin-off, OTT, was also launched.

auth_sentence.res_content: The excitations associated with spin waves are also quantised.

auth_sentence.content: There was always a good spin on his ball.
auth_sentence.res_content: There was always a good spin on his ball.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There was always a good spin on his ball.

Sentence.sentence: The boot time is pretty fast, and he navigates through (浏览 ) a few chapters before swiping into a fully rendered 3D molecule that can be spun around to view its various building blocks.

sentences.en: She got up and spun a little turn.
The explorer spun many fantastic tales about his adventures in the primeval forests.
sentences.cn: 那探险家杜撰了许多他在原始森林里历险的离奇故事。

sentences.en: His grandmother spun him a yarn at the fire.
sentences.cn: 他奶奶在火炉边给他讲故事。

jushi.english: The dancer spun on his toes.
jushi.chinese: 那舞蹈演员以足尖点地旋转身体。

jushi.english: The earth spins on its axis.
